name: TheAtlantic
text: “Trump supporters define the term ‘corruption’ less as the violation of America’s laws than as the violation of America’s traditional hierarchies,” @PeterBeinart writes: https://t.co/F2wX8vx0hq

name: TheAtlantic
text: Utah has been voting by mail for years with "very, very little fraud," the state's lieutenant governor tells @McKayCoppins. What's stopping the rest of the country? https://t.co/fiNNB6ylOZ

name: TheAtlantic
text: "I can’t imagine Trump taking the notion of a responsible transition seriously," William J. Burns writes: https://t.co/e6LY2WONfq

name: TheAtlantic
text: "As the Republican National Convention has vividly illustrated, the GOP has morphed into the Party of Trump, and Republican foreign policy will likely have to reckon with Trumpism for years to come," @thomaswright08 writes: https://t.co/r5jh8LAy3S

name: TheAtlantic
text: “If there’s any time for a couple of guys who sincerely believe in the need to be excellent to each other, now is definitely that time.” @DevinGordonX spoke to the creators and stars of “Bill & Ted Face the Music” about the funny and sweet new film. https://t.co/M7lnIKxaZa

name: TheAtlantic
text: The killings in Kenosha. The Republican National Convention. Hurricane Laura. Our writers weigh in on the events of the week. Plus: Nine suggestions for your weekend. The latest Atlantic Daily, by @mimbsy: https://t.co/cUOigM2zQF

name: TheAtlantic
text: Poems by Pablo Neruda, Robert Hayden, Mona Van Duyn, and more in this week's #TheAtlanticBooksBriefing. From @latham_tori: https://t.co/GSem56Yp55

name: TheAtlantic
text: For millions of families, this fall brings no familiar demarcation when the kids leave, entrusted to the care of others for much of the day. That break in tradition only adds to the stress of the pandemic, @jandersonQZ reports: https://t.co/2Q337JqC3X

name: TheAtlantic
text: This summer, @brdemuth shared an ominous trait with Siberia: Their temperatures both hit 100.4 degrees Fahrenheit. https://t.co/i57iHZqfDS
